description.plain:
Jason Derulo (born Jason Joel Desrouleaux), is an American singer-songwriter and dancer. Since the start of his career as a solo recording artist in 2009, Jason has sold over 30 million singles and has achieved four Top 5 singles, including “Wiggle,” “Talk Dirty,” “In My Head,” and “Whatcha Say.” He is known for singing his name at he beginning of many of his songs.

After producing records and writing songs for several artists, Derulo signed to minor recording label Beluga Heights. After Beluga Heights became part of the Warner Music Group, Derulo released his debut single “Whatcha Say” in May 2009. It sold over five million digital downloads, gaining an RIAA certification of triple platinum, and reaching number 1 in the U.S. and New Zealand. His debut album, Jason Derulo, was released on March 2, 2010.

He released his second studio album, Future History, on September 16, 2011. It was preceded by the release of the UK number-one single “Don’t Wanna Go Home.”

Derulo’s third international album, Tattoos, was released on September 24, 2013 featuring the singles “Marry Me”, “Trumpets”, “Talk Dirty”, and “The Other Side”. Derulo reissued the album a year later under the name Talk Dirty with some additional songs and the single “Wiggle”.

His fourth album Everything is 4 was released on June 2, 2015 featuring the lead single “Want to Want Me”. It was released on March 9, 2015, and topped charts worldwide. It also reached #6 in the US. A year later he released a compilation album, “Platinum Hits” featuring his 11 platinum songs plus the single Kiss the Sky.

From 2017 to 2019, Derulo released singles and collaborations, most notably “Swalla”, “Colors”, and “Goodbye”.

In 2019, Derulo released “2 Sides (Side 1)”, the first of 2 sets of EPs. The second side was set to release in 2020, but has been delayed due to disputes with Warner Brothers.

description.plain:
Jason Derulo teams up with Nicki Minaj and Ty Dolla $ign for “Swalla,” a Caribbean-driven track that serves as the first single for Derulo’s highly anticipated fifth studio album, 2Sides.

On the song, Derulo, Minaj, and Ty go back to their island roots and deliver a sexy pop/dancehall track.

“You know we’re from the islands,” Derulo recently told Billboard. “We really took it there and it’s definitely a must-see.”

songs.title: Wiggle

description.plain:
Jason Derulo teams with A-list sex rapper Snoop Dogg to make “Wiggle,” a joyous pop song about Derulo’s favorite thing: big fat butts. You could say it’s horny in more than one way.

The song has reached the top 10 in a number of countries including Australia, UK and USA.

In Feb. 2016, Derulo was on Jimmy Kimmel, providing a lyrical breakdown of what the song means, kinda like what he did on the site!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15jJFlIHBEk

songs.full_title: Whatcha Say by Jason Derulo
songs.title: Whatcha Say

description.plain:
“Whatcha Say” is an apology song about a man who cheated on his girl and now feels sorry after being caught.

In an interview with Digital Spy, Jason mentioned that the song was based on his brother – “Basically my brother called me one day and said, ‘I cheated on my girl, but I love her so much and I hope she’ll give me one more shot’. I found his story really compelling, so I just went into the studio and tried it out. You know, people go through that kind of thing every day, which is why the song is so relatable. She did take my brother back though and they’re actually engaged now, so it all worked out good in the end.”

“Whatcha Say” became a huge success in late 2009, reaching the top of the Billboard charts on November 14.

(Fun Fact: This song was was originally written for Sean Kingston.)

Production-wise, “Whatcha Say” heavily samples Imogen Heap’s “Hide and Seek”. Find out more about the production here.

songs.full_title: Trumpets by Jason Derulo
songs.title: Trumpets

description.plain:
Jason Derulo released “Trumpets” to International audiences as a single off his third studio album, Tattoos (2013), which he re-titled for release in the US under the name Talk Dirty (2014). “Trumpets” was eventually re-released in the US as the fifth single from Talk Dirty and peaked at number 14 on the US Billboard Hot 100.

Derulo made his directorial debut on the “Trumpets” video, and co-wrote and the song with Jon Bellion who also handled the production. “I met Jason briefly in the studio and played him some of my own solo stuff,” Bellion told Interview Magazine:

He kept my number and called me out of the blue and asked me if I had anything. “Trumpets” was one of those songs. I knew the drums were dope and it could work for someone else, but it was just a bit poppy for me. After my experience with “Monster,” I had to tell him that I wanted 90 percent of the publishing. He was cool with it, he liked it so much…

songs.full_title: Tip Toe by Jason Derulo (Ft. French Montana)
songs.title: Tip Toe

description.plain:
“Tip Toe” features French Montana, as well as uncredited vocals from Soaky Siren. The song was released on November 10, 2017, as the third single from Derulo’s upcoming album, 2 Side (previously title 777), after “If I’m Lucky” and “Swalla” featuring Ty Dolla Sign and Nicki Minaj.

The lyric video was uploaded on Derulo’s official YouTube account on the same day. Also, the single became popular in Europe, like peaking at #5 on UK Singles Chart.

songs.full_title: Want to Want Me by Jason Derulo
songs.title: Want to Want Me

description.plain:
Released on March 9th, 2015, “Want to Want Me” is the first single from Derülo’s fourth studio album, Everything is 4.

The song peaked in the top forty in eight different countries, reaching #6 in the US — Derülo’s sixth consecutive top forty hit and sixth overall top ten.

songs.full_title: Marry Me by Jason Derulo
songs.title: Marry Me

description.plain:
“Marry Me” is the third single from Jason Derulo’s third album, Tattoos, written (2013) for his then girlfriend at the time, Jordin Sparks. The single was later featured on the US version of the album, titled Talk Dirty  (2014).

The couple appeared in the music video together at the time, making it their first and only appearance in a music video together.

songs.full_title: Colors by Jason Derulo
songs.title: Colors

description.plain:
“Colors” by Jason Derulo is Coca-Cola’s official anthem for the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia. Like the previous anthems, this song is a celebration which talks about all the different countries and flags that participate in the competition.

It’s a unifying anthem to the cultural diversity of our world, but it also claims all humans are equal, without races, just a big humankind plenty of colors and beauty.

The FIFA World Cup always links music and soccer like as Ricardo Fort, vice president of Global Sports Partnerships at The Coca-Cola Company, says:

“We believe that music and soccer are intrinsically linked by the passions they evoke. We are excited to welcome Jason to the team, and can’t wait to bring this upbeat anthem to the world ahead of the 2018 FIFA World Cup™.”

songs.title: Get Ugly

description.plain:
“Get Ugly” was released on April 7th, 2015, as the second promo from Jason Derulö’s fourth album, Everything is 4. It wasn’t released as the fourth single from the album until December 2015, though.

It was produced by Wallpaper., the same hit-maker behind previous hits like “Talk Dirty” and “Wiggle.”

songs.full_title: It Girl by Jason Derulo
songs.title: It Girl

description.plain:
The second single from Derulo’s second album Future History is an extreme turn from the lead single off of his eponymous debut album.

“Whatcha Say”, the lead single from Jason Derulo, is about a guy cheating on his girl and him pleading to get her back. Meanwhile, this track is pleading to get together with someone with no cheating implied, just an already existing cute relationship.

The song itself was pretty successful, reaching top forty positions worldwide. In the US, it reached #17. Ironically, that means it wasn’t even his biggest hit from the album: “Don’t Wanna Go Home” reached #14.

songs.full_title: Ridin' Solo by Jason Derulo
songs.title: Ridin’ Solo

description.plain:
“Ridin' Solo” is Jason Derulo’s break up song. Rather than lose sleep over the breakdown of his relationship, he sees it as an opportunity to reclaim his freedom, to enjoy himself without answering to anyone.

The music video features Derulo at the piano singing the sad refrain “love made me blind,” before the futuristic production kicks in and the mood jumps up 10 notches. His positivity was a hit on the charts, as “Ridin' Solo” exploded in popularity worldwide. Top 10 in 5 countries, triple platinum in the US, triple platinum in Australia, and platinum in Canada.

songs.full_title: In My Head by Jason Derulo
songs.title: In My Head

description.plain:
“In My Head” is the third single off the singer’s 2010 album, Jason Derulo.

Billboard describes the song as featuring:

A rocking drumbeat, danceable hook, aggressive synth tap and intense breathy vocals from the artist.

The song peaked at the #12 place in the Billboard Chart and spent 20 weeks on it.

songs.full_title: Cheyenne by Jason Derulo
songs.title: Cheyenne

description.plain:
“Cheyenne” is a single off of Jason Derulo’s Everything Is 4. Jason ends up falling in love with his latest conquest, to his dismay.

The instrumentals incorporate a funky guitar and an electronic bassline, in the vein of “Style”.
